intro: Cacalia obsoleta, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Cacalia obsoleta is generally not cultivated for food but is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
